column4: Principal\rmichael.hoffman@leusd.k12.ca.us\rhttp://wes.leusd.k12.ca.us\r\r----2018-19 School Accountability Report Card\r----Published During the 2019-20 School Year\r\rSuperintendent’s message\rLike the roaring '20s
column5: our district is poised to make some noise in 2020!\rLEUSD student accountability showed meaningful gains with the latest California School Dashboard\rresults. Positive growth in English Language Arts and Math is largely due to LEUSD’s collaborative\rfocus on Professional Learning Communities (PLCs) to provide teachers and principals with critical\rperformance data to guide daily instruction
column6: helping students succeed!\r\rThe district’s first new school in 12 years is greatly anticipated. Alberhill Elementary School will\r------\ropen in August of 2020. This new TK-5 school will feature state-of-the-art solar energy efficiency
column7: \r--\rflexible classroom furniture and configurable classroom space
column9: and\rLake Elsinore Unified School\radvanced campus security systems.\rDistrict\r\r545 Chaney St.\rRecent facilities projects funded by the recent Measure V school bond include flexible classroom\rLake Elsinore
column14: and\r(951) 253-7000\rclassroom technology purchases. Grant funded CTE program expansion will significantly update our\rwww.leusd.k12.ca.us\rexisting engineering
column16: and medical career pathways. All LEUSD high school performing\rDistrict Governing Board\rarts centers have recently received state-of-the-art sound and lighting upgrades
column18: Trustee Area 1\rseating plus stage refurbishments are coming next.\r\r\rSusan E. Scott
column19: Trustee Area 2A previously shuttered campus in Wildomar
column22: Trustee Areaimprovements were recently completed to accommodate the Southern California EMS Training\r3\rInstitute. Phase 2 will include refurbishment of the existing multipurpose room for professional\r\rdevelopment
column25: and expanded parking. Phases 3 and 4\rJuan I. Saucedo
column28: plus\r\rseparate parking. Phase 5 will complete the relocation of our existing Adult Transition Program;\rChristopher J. McDonald
column31: \rArea 5\renabling LEUSD to stay competitive in a statewide teacher shortage.\r\r\r\rDistrict AdministrationAs you can see
column32: 2020 and the beginning of a new decade has plenty for everyone to shout about!\rDr. Doug Kimberly\rSuperintendentSincerely
